thread.title: Local campus watch: Kyle Gronostaj, Molly Pezzulo pace UAlbany cross country
thread.title_full: Local campus watch: Kyle Gronostaj, Molly Pezzulo pace UAlbany cross country

author: Bill Arsenault
title: Local campus watch: Kyle Gronostaj, Molly Pezzulo pace UAlbany cross country
text:
Columbia High graduate Kyle Gronostaj of the UAlbany cross country team. (UAlbany sports information) Columbia High graduate Kyle Gronostaj of the UAlbany cross country... Image 2 of 3 
Columbia High graduate Kyle Gronostaj of the UAlbany cross country team. (UAlbany sports information) Columbia High graduate Kyle Gronostaj of the UAlbany cross country... Image 3 of 3 
Saratoga Springs High graduate Molly Pezzulo of the UAlbany cross country team. (UAlbany sports information) Saratoga Springs High graduate Molly Pezzulo of the UAlbany cross... Local campus watch: Kyle Gronostaj, Molly Pezzulo pace UAlbany cross country 1 / 3 Back to Gallery 
The University at Albany men's and women's cross country teams competed in Lehigh's 42nd annual Paul Short Run last Friday in Bethlehem, Pa., the men finishing 25th and the women seventh in the Gold Division race. 
Sophomore Kyle Gronostaj of East Greenbush (Columbia High) led the Danes men, finishing 29th in a field of 278 runners. His 8k (4.97-mile) time was 24 minutes, 41.3 seconds. Senior Zachary Cook of Albany (Bishop Maginn High) was 158th (26:15.4). 
Senior Molly Pezzulo of Saratoga Springs (Saratoga High) finished 31st out of 312 runners with a 6k (3.73-mile) time of 21:17. Junior Schuyler Pruyn of Rexford (Burnt Hills High) finished 63rd (21:39). The Saints were led by junior Jessica Donohue of Glen Head, who finished 14th (20:55). This is a TU+ story. Click for more information. 
Siena competed in the Brown Division and the women finished tied for 17th out of 45 schools. Junior Shannon Bauer of Warwick finished 28th out of 386 runners with a program record 6k time of 22:10. Senior Christie MacFarlane of Delmar ( Bethlehem High ) was 52nd (22:29), freshman Sarah Foreman of Altamont (Guilderland High) was 88th (22:51), sophomore Dominica Bleichert of Clifton Park (Shenendehowa High) was 102nd (22:58) and junior Sydney Sericolo of Valatie ( Ichabod Crane ) was 154th (23:26). The Siena men finished ninth out of 39 teams. 
St. Rose competed in the White Division race, the men finishing sixth out of 39 teams, the women 17th out of 43 teams. Junior Ben Kapuscinski of Sea Cliff led the men, finishing ninth out of 308 runners with an 8k time of 26:06. Junior Michelle Lujan of Cornwell led the women, finishing 18th out of 328 runners with a 6k time of 23:10. Senior Emily Becker of Perth (Broadalbin-Perth) finished 99th in 25:10. 
Strauss makes them count 
Sophomore forward Ethan Strauss of Delmar (Bethlehem High) took just one shot in the game but it found the back of the net at the 77:51 mark to give Union a 1-0 victory over New Paltz in a nonleague men's soccer game last Thursday. 
Strauss has had just eight shots on goal for the 6-1-2 Dutchmen and he's scored five times. 
Goal for Batzinger 
Sophomore Kate Batzinger of Niskayuna (Niskayuna High) scored her first goal of the season to help the RPI field hockey team defeat St. Lawrence 3-0 in a Liberty League contest last Saturday in Troy. The 5-foot-2 midfielder took a penalty corner, picked up her own rebound and scored inside the left post as RPI moved to 6-3 overall and 1-1 in league play. 
Tommell leads the way 
Junior Taylor Tommell finished third in a field of 91 to help the Cobleskill women's cross country team finish second in a field of 12 at the Cazenovia Homecoming Invitational last Saturday. Tommell, from Guilderland (Guilderland High), covered the 5,750-meter course in 23:48. Freshman Quinn Porter of Ballston Spa (Burnt Hills High) finished seventh (24:06) while senior Megan Jenney of Troy (Catholic Central) was 26th (26:01). 
Good league start for Sage 
The Sage women's volleyball team opened the Skyline Conference season by posting 3-0 victories over Old Westbury and St. Joseph's last Saturday in Patchogue. 
The Gators, 12-7 overall, are getting solid performances from a number of area athletes led by senior Mickey Mango of Saratoga Springs (Saratoga High) with 143 kills and 44 blocks. Junior Siena Wilder of Ballston Lake (Burnt Hills High) has 268 digs and 42 aces and junior Rachel Liebig of Hartford ( Hartford Central ) has 510 assists. 
Vikings men still rolling 
The Hudson Valley men's soccer team defeated Springfield Tech 2-0 and Fulton-Montgomery 6-0 last week, moving the Vikings to 9-1-1 on the season. 
Freshman Jonathan Mejicano of Cairo (Cairo-Durham) scored two goals against Fulton-Montgomery and his twin brother Juan Mejicano got a goal in each game. Eliden Bardhollari of Colonie (Colonie High) had a goal against Springfield while Dominic Sloma of Niskayuna (Niskayuna High) and Adam Kaarstad of Wynantskill (Troy High) scored against Fulton-Montgomery.
